definition.text: Indonesia is a sovereign archipelagic republic in Southeast Asia composed of more than 17,000 islands. It is the worldâ€™s largest Muslim-majority country and one of the most populous nations globally. Indonesia has a diversified economy based on natural resources, manufacturing, and services, and plays a central geopolitical role within ASEAN and the broader Indo-Pacific region.

works.title: Actor Set Evolution of Indonesia
works.description: Temporal mapping of Indonesiaâ€™s actor space from colonial administration and independence-era leadership to the New Order regime, post-1998 reforms, decentralization, and contemporary political-economic coalitions.

works.title: Archipelagic Spatial-Administrative Structure
works.description: Geospatial representation of Indonesiaâ€™s provinces, maritime corridors, resource basins, and inter-island economic integration patterns.

works.title: Commodity and Industrial Network Structure
works.description: Network analysis of Indonesiaâ€™s commodity exports (coal, palm oil, nickel), downstream industrialization strategies, and integration into global value chains.
